skillTree.localised_description: Tzeentch's authority is absolute, for infinite change is the very nature of Chaos.
The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.
The followers of Chaos need not to rest, they march on with iron hearts desperate to harvest souls.
This Lord speaks with a dread booming voice - a gift from his Dark Masters to ensure obedience.
The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
The Priest’s minions are useful even in death, for their life force can be harnessed to empower Urak’s incantations.
Urak can manipulate reality itself around him, ensuring that enemy attacks fail when they would have otherwise succeeded.
Flaming vultures whirl through enemy lines, incinerating anyone caught in a swoop.
Urak beckons the earth to spit forth twisted shards.
A barrage of raw magical energy can devastate even the most well-armoured foes.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit is unable to activate abilities or cast spells.
This unit is unable to activate abilities or cast spells.

skillTree.localised_description: Molten lava and balls of flame erupt out of the ground, burning armour, flesh and souls alike.

effects.description: Overcast spell: "Piercing Bolts of Burning Upgraded"
Overcast spell: "Piercing Bolts of Burning Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Piercing Bolts of Burning"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Piercing Bolts of Burning Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Piercing Bolts of Burning Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Masters of hidden spells and incantations, Arcanists of Tzeentch are masters at manipulating the Winds of Magic to send crackling fury at the enemy.

effects.description: Mount: "Lightning Bolt" variant (projectiles cause distorted effect) for Urak Soulbane

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

A unit with the Mark of Tzeentch has:
	➕  Barrier
	➕  Magical Attacks

skillTree.localised_description: Urak’s voice echoes through the battlefield, diminishing the will of the enemy with his dark incantations while simultaneously empowering his men to fight hard, lest they be on the receiving end of his wrath.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Treason of Tzeentch Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Unlike most other sorcerers of Tzeentch, Urak is a well-established entrepreneur, owning front businesses across human society.
When enemies gaze into the eyes of insanity, insanity has a way of gazing back.
"The Eagle protects me, for I am but a vessel of change!"
The Winds of Magic twist and churn around Tzeentch's almighty Paragons of Change.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: A Chaos Lord dominates – lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To the Northmen, there is no greater honour than to fight and perish under the gaze of the Gods.

skillTree.localised_description: Mutations awarded by the Chaos Gods to their followers may look horrific to southerners, but such gifts are prized.

skillTree.localised_description: Tzeentchian tyrants and Lords, whose word is law, ensure their troops will not run by issuing this dread order.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."

effects.description: Unit Upgrades cost: -5% for all units
Unit Upgrades cost: -10% for all units

skillTree.localised_description: No act of faith can rival reaving the souls of the slain; a dark and twisted offering in honour of the Ruinous Powers.

skillTree.localised_description: "This stinking mortal Hold will fall, my masters have foreseen it. Bring them ruin!"

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Arch-Sorcerers are the absolute zenith of magical prowess and are rightfully feared by Daemons & mortals alike.
